name: TriggerBuild
description: This tasks allows to trigger a new Build (add it to the queue) as part of a Build Definition. It contains as well some conditions that can be applied, for example if the last build of certain definition was successful or not.
author: Benjamin Huser

inputs.name: definitionIsInCurrentTeamProject
inputs.label: True if the build to be triggered is defined within the same team project as this build

inputs.name: tfsServer
inputs.label: URL to TFS Server (including Collection and Team Project)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The TFS Server the Build you want to trigger is located. Example: https://<YOURACCOUNT>.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/<TEAMPROJECT>

inputs.name: buildDefinition
inputs.label: Name of the Build Definitions that shall be triggered
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of names of the definition that we want to queue a new build for.

inputs.name: queueBuildForUserThatTriggeredBuild
inputs.label: Queue Build for user that triggered original build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will run for the same user that triggered the original build.

inputs.name: ignoreSslCertificateErrors
inputs.label: Ignore SSL Certificate Errors
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled possible certificate errors (for example untrusted CA's) will be ignored

inputs.name: useSameSourceVersion
inputs.label: Use current changeset for the triggered build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will run with the same source version as the original build. If this is not enabled, the newest version will be used.

inputs.name: useSameBranch
inputs.label: Use same source branch as triggered build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will be run with the same source branch as the original build. This only makes sense if the triggered build is within the same project and is cause for error if the branch is not available in the triggered build!

inputs.name: branchToUse
inputs.label: Defines Branch that shall be used
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the branch that shall be used for the triggered build if we don't use the same branch as the original build, for example: refs/heads/master

inputs.name: waitForQueuedBuildsToFinish
inputs.label: Wait till the triggered builds are finished before build continues
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the script will wait until the all the queued builds are finished. Note: This can take a while depending on your builds and your build will not continue. If you only have one build agent you will even end up in a deadlock situation!

inputs.name: waitForQueuedBuildsToFinishRefreshTime
inputs.label: Time (in seconds) to wait between checks for the build
inputs.helpMarkDown: This value defines how often the tasks checks if the triggered builds are completed already

inputs.name: failTaskIfBuildsNotSuccessful
inputs.label: Fail the build if the tasks were not successful
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fails this build if one of the triggered tasks was not successful

inputs.name: storeInEnvironmentVariable
inputs.label: Store triggered build id's in a variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: When enabled, the triggered build id's will be stored in a variable called TriggeredBuildIds that will be available for subsequent Tasks. In case of multiple triggered builds, the values will be separated by ','

inputs.name: buildParameters
inputs.label: Define additional parameters for the build, for example build configuration or platform.
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the build parameters.If nothing is specified, the default values will be used. See Build Task description for more info on the format and the usage of variables.

inputs.name: authenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select your method of authentication (Default Credentials is deprecated and will be removed in later versions - will internally use OAuth Token).

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: The username that shall be used to authenticate if basic authentication is used

inputs.name: password
inputs.label: The password, Personal Access Token or OAuth Token to authenticate
inputs.helpMarkDown: If OAuth Authentication is used, leaving this empty will try to use the System.AccessToken - make sure to enable this build to allow scripts to access the token in the options!

inputs.name: enableBuildInQueueCondition
inputs.label: Enable Build In Queue Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will only be triggered if none of the specified build definitions is currently waiting in a queue.

inputs.name: includeCurrentBuildDefinition
inputs.label: Include current Build Definition as blocking Build
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, current build definition is included in Builds that block trigger of new build.

inputs.name: blockingBuildsList
inputs.label: Blocking Build Definitions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of build definitions that will prevent triggering a new build if they are currently waiting in a queue.

inputs.name: dependentOnSuccessfulBuildCondition
inputs.label: Enable Successful Build Dependency Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will only be triggered if the last builds of all the specified builds were successful.

inputs.name: dependentBuildsList
inputs.label: Dependent Build Definitions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of build definitions that will prevent triggering a new build if the last builds run were not successful.

inputs.name: dependentOnFailedBuildCondition
inputs.label: Enable Failed Build Dependency Condition
inputs.helpMarkDown: If enabled, build will only be triggered if the last builds of all the specified builds were **not** successful.  Can be used to automatically trigger a build once all the dependent builds are fixed if the last try (e.g. a scheduled build during the night) failed.

inputs.name: dependentFailingBuildsList
inputs.label: Dependent Build Definitions
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-Separated list of build definitions that will prevent triggering a new build if the last builds run were successful.
